poem:
Title: "On Cradles and Graves"

Cradles to graves,
an eloquent promise.
Yet, the old reaps,
and the young – bloom voiceless.

Pensions flourish like crimson trees,
while infant sands shift, misplaced in the breeze.

The ballot silently bleeds,
as Sunak leads.
Parents tread on electoral beads,
cunningly, they disregard infantile needs.

A welfare state, wisp of a tale,
where saplings go frail,
and the old, prevail.
